title: Arterial Tortuosity Syndrome: Epidemiology and Clinical Overview
short_description: Clinical document describing the epidemiology, prevalence, and demographic characteristics of arterial tortuosity syndrome.
long_description: This clinical research document provides an epidemiological overview of arterial tortuosity syndrome, a rare genetic disorder affecting blood vessel structure. The document discusses the equal gender distribution of the condition, notes that approximately 100 cases have been documented in medical literature, and addresses the challenges in determining accurate incidence and prevalence rates due to potential underdiagnosis or misdiagnosis. It emphasizes that the condition typically manifests during infancy or early childhood, highlighting the importance of early recognition and diagnosis in pediatric populations.
